intro: Xerospermum laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth xerospermum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flower heads that are typically borne in clusters. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions.
